content:
1.4 Warming Up machine

After starting up the machine, we recommend warming it up for about ten minutes in most cases. If less

than two hours has elapsed after the machine was last used, no warm-up is necessary.

Step 1 Press the [Warm Up] button on the “Setup” screen.

The “Warm Up” screen will appear.

Step 2 Enter a warm-up time.

Press the [stop after time over] button and enter the warm-up time. Warm-up will automatically

stop when the warm-up time you set has elapsed. Normally, about a 10-minute warm-up is

sufficient.

Warm-up time setting #1

“Setup” screen

Path Image Warm-up time setting #1 : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.4_Warm_up_time_setting_1.png

Step 3 Start warming up the machine.

Press the [Start] button to start warm-up. The elapsed warm-up progress time and status will

appear in the “Progress status” column.

CAUTION

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
appear in the “Progress status” column.

CAUTION

If an abnormality occurs during warm-up, press the [stop] button to stop operation immediately, and check the cause of the problem and eliminate it.

Warm-up time setting #2

Path Image Warm-up time setting #2 : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.4_Warm_up_time_setting_2.png

Step 4 Finish the warm-up.

Warm-up will automatically stop when the warm-up time you set in Step 2 is reached.

Press the [Close] button, and return to the previous screen.

content:
1.6 Conveyor Unit Setup

Set up (Get ready) the conveyor unit according to the selected board data.

The following three tasks for setting up the conveyor unit are required–“Laying out push-up pins”,

“Adjusting board hold plate position” and “Checking condition of clamping board”.

board clamping method

Normally, the board is clamped by setting the “board fix device” parameter to “Edge Clamp”.

In this method, a board will be clamped by the following steps.

1. The board transferred on the conveyor stops.

• For Dual-stage and Single-lane, the board stops at the mounting position

when it comes into contact with the main stopper.

• For Dual-lane, the board is detected by the sensor at the mounting position

and stops at the defined position.

2. The clamp board assembly pushes up the edge of the board so that the board is secured in place

between the clamp board assembly and the board hold plate.

3. Other than the edge of the board, the push-up pins support the board from under.

board clamping method

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
board clamping method

Path Image board clamping method : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.6_Board_clamping_method.png

CAUTION

If the board to be processed has a slit or the like, some of the conveyor sensors might not be able to detect the board. In such a case, changing the machine settings and adjusting the sensor positions might be required. Before starting the actual production, make absolutely sure that the boards are transferred correctly as intended.

NOTE

This machine follows the “Edge clamp” method to clamp a board. If using other method to clamp the board, the machine may need to be modified or evaluated.

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
1.6.1 Laying Out Push-Up Pins

CAUTION

The procedure described in this section requires the conveyor unit and push-up plate to actually operate to get ready for production. Before starting the procedure in this section, be absolutely sure to check the conveyor and its peripherals according to “1.1 Pre-Operation Check” in this chapter.

Step 1 (Only for Dual-stage) Move the conveyor into the mounting position.

1. Press the [Mount Position] button on the “Setup” screen.

2. The message “Move conveyor unit To mounting position” will be displayed, and then press the

[Yes] button. The conveyor width will change to that specified in the board data, and then the

mounting stage 2 will move into the mounting position.

NOTE

When using a board of L=380 mm or less, the mounting stage 2 will move to the rear side of the machine. Otherwise, when using a board longer than L=380 mm, the mounting stage will not move.

Moving the conveyor into the mounting position

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
Moving the conveyor into the mounting position

Path Image Moving the conveyor into the mounting position : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.6_1.6.1_conveyor_into_mounting_position.png

NOTE

Pressing the [Mount Position] button also makes the conveyor width changed to the width specified in the board data.

Step 2 (For Dual-stage/Single-lane) Lift the main stopper.

Lift the main stopper to place the board at the board mounting position.

Press the [Main stopper] button on the [Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen to lift the main stopper.

For Dual-stage type machines, press the [Main stopper] buttons for both of stage 1 and stage 2 to

lift the main stoppers.

NOTE

Dual-lane type machines do not use stoppers, so proceed to the next step.

Lifting main stopper

[Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen (Example: Dual-stage)

Step 3 Move up the push-up plate.

1. Press the [Push Up] button on the [Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen.

Then the “conveyor push up” screen will appear.

2. After checking the board thickness is correct, press the [OK] button to move up the push-up

plate.

3. For Dual-stage type machines, move up the push-up plates for both stage 1 and stage 2 by

following the procedure 1 and 2 above. For Dual-lane type machines, switch the lanes and do so.

Moving up push-up plate

[Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen (Example: Dual-stage)

content:
Moving up push-up plate

[Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen (Example: Dual-stage)

Path Image Moving up push-up plate : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.6_1.6.1_Moving_up_pushup_plate.png

Step 4 Lay out the push-up pins.

The push-up pins are fixed on the push-up plate with magnets.

For Dual-stage type

1. Press the emergency stop button.

2. Unclamp the feeder exchange carriage and detach it.

3. Open the machine safety cover, and remove the upper cover when needed.

4. Temporarily place the board on the conveyor of mounting stage 1, so that the board edge

contacts to main stopper.

5. Confirm the board size (meaning the area where the push-up pins are placed), and then

temporarily remove the board.

6. Lay out the push-up pins on the push-up plate so that the whole board including its edge are held

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
evenly by the pins. Be careful not to touch the components if they are mounted on the back side

of the board already.

7. Lay out the push-up pins of the mounting stage 2 by the same procedures.

Temporarily placing board

Example: Mounting stage 1

Path Image Temporarily placing board : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.6_1.6.1_Temporarily_placing_board.png

For Dual-lane type

1. Place the board at the entrance of the conveyor on the lane 1 and press the [conveyor setup]

button on the “Setup” screen.

2. Press the [convey board] button. Check the “Specify position” box, and select “Entrance Pos.” for

“Start Pos.” and “Upper Mount Pos.” for “Target Pos.” Uncheck the “board fix” box and press the

[OK] button. The board will be transferred to the upstream mounting position.

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
[OK] button. The board will be transferred to the upstream mounting position.

Since there are two mounting stages, follow the same procedure for the downstream mounting

position.

3. Press the emergency stop button.

4. Unclamp the feeder exchange carriage and detach it.

5. Open the machine safety cover, and remove the upper cover if necessary.

6. Check the board size (meaning the area where the push-up pins are placed), and then temporarily

remove the board.

7. Considering the board shape and size, lay out the push-up pins on the push-up plate so that the

whole board including its edge are held evenly by the pins.

If the components have already been mounted on the back side of the board, place the pins

carefully so that they do not contact the components.

8. Lay out the push-up pins for the lane 2 by the same procedures.

Layout of push-up pins

Viewed from above (Example: Dual-stage)

metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

Layout of push-up pins

CAUTION

Lay out the push-up pins in a manner that when the push-up plate lifts, it does not come into collision with the conveyor rail or other parts. Do not change the distance between the bottom face of the magnet stand and the tip of the pin that is adjusted to 76 mm.

NOTE

It may be convenient to mark the positions of the push-up pins on the push-up plate with stickers, a permanent marker or the like for each board type.

Step 5 Release the emergency stop.

1. Close the upper cover and machine safety cover.

2. Attach the feeder exchange carriage on machine.

3. Release the emergency stop button.

1.6.2 Adjusting Board Hold Plate Position

Step 1 Enter the board.

1. For Dual-stage/Dual-lane, press the [convey board] button on the [Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen.

2. (For Dual-stage/Dual-lane) The “convey boards” screen will appear.

Check that the “All position” and “board fix” checkboxes are selected, and then press the [OK]

button.

3. When the “CONVEY AND FIX” message screen appears, set the board onto the conveyor entrance

of the machine.

4. After pressing the [OK] button on the “CONVEY AND FIX” screen, the board will be transferred

and fixed on the mounting position.

(For Dual-stage/Dual-lane, the board will be fixed on the mounting stage 1.)

Entering board

Step 3 Adjust the board hold plate positions.

Step 4 (For Dual-stage/Dual-lane) Adjust the board hold plate positions

content:
5. The “convey boards” screen will appears, so check the “All position” and “board fix” checkboxes

are selected, and then press the [OK] button.

6. The “CONVEY AND FIX” message screen will appear, then press the [OK] button. The board will

be conveyed from the mounting stage 1 of upstream to the mounting stage 2 of downstream,

and it will be fixed at its mounting position on the mounting stage 2.

7. Adjust the board hold plate positions on the mounting stage 2 by Steps 2 and 3.

Step 5 Remove the board.

1. Close the upper cover and safety cover.

2. Attach the feeder exchange carriage.

3. Release the emergency stop button.

4. For Dual-stage/Dual-lane, press the [convey board] button on the [Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen.

For Single-lane, press the [Convey Out] button on the [Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen.

checkbox is selected, and then press the [OK] button.

metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
checkbox is selected, and then press the [OK] button.

6. The “CONVEY AND FIX” message screen will appear, then press the [OK] button.

The board will be transferred from the mounting position (mounting stage 2 for Dual-stage/

Dual-lane) to the exit conveyor.

7. Remove the board manually.

NOTE

In this case, the board was conveyed in the “All position” setting. If the “Specify Position” checkbox is selected on the “convey boards” screen and one of “Entrance Pos.”, “Upper Mount Pos.”, “Lower Mount Pos.”, or “Exit Pos.” is selected for the “Start Pos.” and “Target Pos.”, the board can be conveyed only between at the specified point.

CAUTION

For Dual-lane type, if a board is fixed without the board hold plates positioned on the board, the board may be lifted at an angle and the head may collide with the board.

The square board hold plates are located so that they are positioned on the board, irrespective of the board size. Therefore, do not change their locations.

content:
1.6.3 Checking Condition of Clamping Board

Step 1 Enter the board.

See Step 1 in “1.6.2 adjusting board Hold Plate Position” to convey the board in the same way.

Step 2 Check the board clamping condition.

1. Press the emergency stop button.

2. Unclamp the carriage and detach it.

3. Open the machine safety cover, and remove the upper cover when needed.

4. Tap the several points on the board with the finger and visually check the board from side to see

that the push-up pins evenly support the board.

5. Visually check the board from side to see that the board is not excessively warped downward or

upward.

6. Especially around the left and right edges of the board, check that the board is not lifted or

sagging from the conveyor frame.

7. If the board is not clamped correctly after checking 4 to 6 above, adjust the locations of push-up

pins and board hold plates or add the push-up pins to correct the condition and recheck.

Checking condition of clamping board

NOTE

The allowable warp of component mounting boards for YRM20/YRM20DL is 0.5 mm or less upwards and 1.0 mm or less downwards.

Step 3 (For Dual-stage/Dual-lane) Check the board is clamped on the mounting stage 2.

1. Close the upper cover and safety cover.

2. Attach the carriage to machine.

3. Release the emergency stop button.

2. Attach the carriage to machine.

3. Release the emergency stop button.

4. Press the [convey board] button on [Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen.

5. The “convey boards” screen will appear. Check that “All position” and “board fix” checkboxes

are selected, and then press the [OK] button.

6. The “CONVEYOR AND FIX” message will appear, then press the [OK] button twice. The board will

be conveyed from the mounting stage 1 of upstream to the mounting stage 2 of downstream,

and the board will be fixed at its mounting position of mounting stage 2.

7. See Step 2 to check the conveyor clamped condition on the downstream stage.

Step 4 Remove the board.

1. Close the upper cover and machine safety cover.

2. Attach the carriage to machine.

3. Release the emergency stop button.

For Single-lane, press the [Convey Out] button on [Unit] > [conveyor] tab screen.

1.7 Preparing Component Tape (for Tape Feeder)

When the conveyor gets ready for operation, prepare the component tape. This procedure description in

this section assumes that the board data to be used for production has been read out.

Step 1 Open the “Required Parts” screen.

Press the [Required Parts] button and the “Required Parts” screen will appear.

Step 2 Set the feeders loaded with component tape.

The “Required Parts” screen lists the “Set Num.”, “Parts Name”, “Parts No.”, and other parameters.

While referring to this list, attach the tape feeders with component tapes in each corresponding

feeder set position, or attach the feeder exchange carriage with tape feeders set to the machine.

TIP

See “4. Preparing Component tape” in Chapter 2 for the procedure to set component tape into the feeder and attach the feeder to main machine.

NOTE

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
NOTE

• When attaching feeder exchange carriages, the Set Num. (that is, feeder set position) F1 to F64 are used for the one to be attached onto the front of the machine, and F101 to F164 for the one to be attached onto the rear of the machine.

• When attaching eATS30 or sATS30R (Tray Component Supply Units), P1 to P30 are the pallet numbers used for the one to be attached onto the front of the machine, P101 to P130 for the one to be attached onto the rear of the machine.

• When attaching cATS10R (Tray Component Supply Unit), P1 to P10 are the pallet numbers used for the one to be attached onto the front of the machine, P101 to P110 for the one to be attached onto the rear of the machine.

Preparing component tape

“Setup” screen > “Required Parts” screen

Prepare the tray components. This procedure description in this section assumes that the board data to be

used for production has been read out.

Step 1 Open the “Required Parts” screen.

Pressing the [Required Parts] button makes the “Required Parts” screen pop up.

Step 2 Set the pallets loaded with components.

There are several information such as “Set Num.”, “Parts Name” and “Parts No.” listed in [Required

Parts] screen. “Set Num.” for the tray components are indicated with “P1 to P30 and P101 to P130”.

Set the pallets loaded with components onto the rack where the Tray Component Supply Unit is to

be set.

TIP

See the Option Manual for details on how to set a component tray onto a pallet and how to set a magazine and pallet into the Tray Component Supply Unit.

1.9 Checking Nozzles

Check the nozzles before starting the production. This procedure description in this section assumes that

the board data to be used for production has been read out. Note that Steps 1 and 2 are not necessary

where the setting is such that all the heads go through the automatic nozzle changing process.

Step 1 Open the “required nozzles” screen.

Press the [required nozzles] button on the “Setup” screen, then the “required nozzles” screen will

appear.

Step 2 Check the nozzle types.

If the machine is not equipped with the nozzle station or the machine has a head that does not go

through the automatic nozzle changing process, the types of nozzles appear on the “nozzle type”

list. Check that these nozzles in the list match the nozzles that are currently attached on the heads.

Note that this process is not necessary if set to “auto nozzle”.

checking nozzle types

“Setup” screen > “required nozzles” screen

Checking nozzle types

Step 3 Open the “CHECK NOZZLES” screen.

Press the [Tip Cln Check] button on the “Setup” screen. The “CHECK NOZZLES” screen will appear.

Step 4 Perform the nozzle tip cleanliness Check.

Check the contents of the “CHECK NOZZLES” screen and then select any of the following buttons.

[Yes] button: Automatic nozzle change process will be performed to check all the target

nozzles.

[No] button: Among the nozzles currently attached to the heads, only the target nozzles

will be checked.

[Cancel] button: Cancel the operation.

NOTE

will be checked.

[Cancel] button: Cancel the operation.

NOTE

The “nozzle tip cleanness Check” is a function that the camera views the nozzle tips without components to judge the nozzle cleanness. Since the camera recognizes the reflection of light coming from solder deposited around the nozzle tips, the camera works for small tip nozzles such as 8103A, 8104A, 8105A, 8106A, 8107A, 8108A, 8004H, 8006H and the like.

nozzle tip cleanness check

• The “nozzle tip cleanness check” is available if it is specified on the “machine setting”.

• Since dirt deposits gradually, the check may turn out to be OK or NG (means not good) if   checking a few times at the initial

stage of accumulating dirt.

content:
1.10 Starting Production

This procedure description in this section assumes that the board data to be used for production has been

read out.

Step 1 Set the operation speed.

Set the automatic operation speed. Although normally set to 100% of the speed, the operation

speed can be slowed down when it is necessary to confirm the operation such as testing the

mounting of components on a new board.

Change the operation speed by pressing the [△ ] button of the “Condition” column on the “Setup”

screen or directly entering the speed values into the “Speed”.

Setting operation speed

“Setup” screen

Path Image Setting operation speed : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.10_Setting_operation_speed.png

Step 2 Start the automatic operation.

1. (If the emergency stop button has been pressed) Cancel the emergency stop and press the

[READY] button on the operation display.

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
[READY] button on the operation display.

2. Press the [START] button on the operation display. When the sensor at the loading port of the

conveyor detects a board, the conveyor belt starts rotating, transfers the board to the mounting

position and starts mounting the components on the board.

WARNING

the green signal light lights up when the machine is operating. the signal light lights up in yellow (blue) if an error occurs or machine goes through the interlocked operation. the signal light lights up in red (white) in an emergency stop. make absolutely sure that when the signal light stays green, never attempt to enter the motion envelope of the head units.

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
1.11 Ending Production

The following describes the procedure for ending board production.

Step 1 stop the machine operation.

The following four methods stop the machine operation.

1. [STOP] button (on the bottom side of operation display)

Use this [STOP] button to pause the machine operation.

To resume machine operation, press the [START] button.

2. [Cycle stop] button (on the “Setup” screen)

Pressing this button will stop the machine without carrying the mounted board to the

downstream machine when the mounting for the current board is completed.

3. [Convey-out stop] button (on the “Setup” screen)

Use this button to end production after the boards currently on the conveyor have been mounted.

All boards on the conveyor will be mounted and carried out, and new boards will not be carried in

from the upstream machine.

4. Emergency stop button

Press this button to trigger emergency stop.

Normally, do not use this button to stop automatic operation.

CAUTION

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
Normally, do not use this button to stop automatic operation.

CAUTION

Do not press the emergency stop button during operation except in case of emergency.

[Cycle stop] button / [Convey-out stop] button

“Setup” screen

Path Image [Cycle stop] button / [Convey-out stop] button : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.11_Cycle_Stop_Conveyout_Stop.png

Step 2 Reset the operation.

Press the [RESET] button on the operation display.

The machine then returns to the board production standby status.

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
1.12 Powering Off machine

This section describes how to power off the machine after finishing the production.

Step 1 Bring the machine back to the state of ready for production.

If the emergency stop button has been pressed, cancel the emergency stop and press the [READY]

button on the operation display.

NOTE

Cancel the emergency stop to execute the return-to-origin before powering off the machine. If powering off the machine without executing return-to-origin, the machine can be in the state of emergency stop.

Step 2 Press the “power off” button.

Press the power off button in the status area of the screen, then the “SHUT DOWN” screen will

appear.

Step 3 Confirm that the machine is powered off.

Press the [Yes] button on the “SHUT DOWN” screen.

Powering off machine

“SHUT DOWN” screen

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
Press the [Yes] button on the “SHUT DOWN” screen.

Powering off machine

“SHUT DOWN” screen

Path Image Powering off machine : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.12_Powering_off_machine.png

Step 4 Execute return-to-origin.

The “Return to origin” screen will appear. Press the [OK] button.

Step 5 When the Shut Down screen appears, press the [OK] button.

NOTE

If the feeder exchange carriage is equipped, “Unclamp Carriage” screen will appear.

Check and press the [OK] or [Cancel] button.

Step 6 Press the emergency stop button.

When the emergency stop screen appears, press the emergency stop button and then press the

[OK] button. By pressing the emergency stop button, the application will start power shutdown

process.

Step 7 Turn off the main switch of the machine.

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
process.

Step 7 Turn off the main switch of the machine.

When completing the power shutdown process, a message “NO SIGNAL” will appear on the screen.

When confirming the message, turn the main switch at the lower right of the main machine to the

left to shut it down.

CAUTION

• Do not turn off the main switch unnecessarily while ignoring the set procedure. Otherwise, destruction of data or damage to devices could occur.

• Do not turn on the main switch immediately after turning it off. Otherwise, such an operation could lead to damage to the control board. Be sure to wait for two seconds or so after powering off the machine before turning it on again.

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
1.13 Resuming Operation from Stopped Point

If resuming to mount a board that has been reset due to an error occurrence in the middle of production or

mounting the components on a particular block or at a particular mounting point, use this “Halfway Continue

(Resuming operation from the stopped point)” function. Note that this function can be used just for the first

board after the operation is resumed, with routine mounting operation beginning from the next board.

Step 1 Press the [Halfway Continue] button.

Press the [Halfway Continue] button on the “Setup” screen, then the “Save abort information”

screen will appear.

Step 2 Read out the aborted information that has been saved.

After confirming the “Save Date/Time” and other details on the “Save abort information” screen,

press the [OK] button to open the “Halfway Continue” screen after the “CONFIRMATION OF BOARD

FIX” screen opens.

NOTE

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
FIX” screen opens.

NOTE

When system error occurred and machine stopped due to power outage, the error message “Check the inside of machine” may appear in addition to “CONFIRMATION OF BOARD FIX” screen. In this case, follow the message and check machine inside.

Halfway Continue

“Setup” screen > “Halfway Continue” screen

Path Image Halfway Continue : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.13_Halfway_Continue.png

Step 3 Check and edit the state of mounting.

Check the component mounting state in the aborted information. For instance, if the machine has

stopped due to an error after a head picked up a component, the mounting information column

indicates “Unknown”.

After selecting the mounting points to be checked, press the [Trace] button to move the head unit

(that is, camera) to the actual mounting position. While checking each mounting point on the board

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
(that is, camera) to the actual mounting position. While checking each mounting point on the board

using the camera, mark the “mount state setting” checkbox to change the mount state of the

selected mounting point.

After changing the mount state setting to “Done” or “Undone” for all the “Unknown” mount points,

press the [OK] button to exit the screen.

NOTE

Pressing the [OK] button while an “Unknown” mounting point still remains, an error message will appear, and the “Halfway Continue” screen cannot be closed.

Editing on “Halfway Continue” screen

“Halfway Continue” screen

Path Image Editing on “Halfway Continue” screen : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.13_Editing_Halfway_Continue.png

NOTE

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
NOTE

When using the block offset function for a multi-board, for instance, selecting the “Offset No” enables to edit the state of components mounting per block. However, the editing on the “Halfway Continue” screen is available only when mounting the first board.

Step 4 Resume the automatic operation.

Press the [START] button to resume the automatic operation. The machine starts mounting the

components at the mounting points set to “Undone” on the first board after resumption.

“Block Skip” function

The “Halfway Continue” function is available for operation to mount components only at specified

mounting points by setting the mounting status. This function is therefore not only useful in the event

of an error but also when going through trial/test mounting. This machine provides the “Block Skip”

function that is similar to the “Halfway Continue” operation. The “Block Skip” function enables to

designate whether to mount components or skip mounting per block.

TIP

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
designate whether to mount components or skip mounting per block.

TIP

The block skip function can only be used for board data that the block distribution (with Note Data) was performed. See Surface Programming Manual for information on block distribution.

NOTE

For using board data created by other machine of an earlier version (earlier than V3.11STDR1.00), it is necessary to redo the block distribution on this machine. Note, however, that this function is not available for board data if it has 512 or more block offsets before the block distribution.

Step 1 Press the [Block Skip] button.

Press the [Block Skip] button on the “Setup” screen to open the “Block Skip setting dialog” screen.

Block Skip function

“Setup” screen > “Block Skip setting dialog” screen

Path Image Block Skip function : Manual_image/product_manual/YRM/Operator_Manual/Flowchart_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production/Chapter_3_Flow_from_machine_Startup_to_End_of_Production_1_1.13_Block_Skip_function.png

content:
NOTE

When the [Block Skip] button is displayed in blue, it indicates that the “Block Skip” function is enabled. To disable this function, press the [Block Skip] button displayed in blue again. In addition, if the machine reads a board data with a different name or if the machine is powered off, this function will be enabled and the selection of the [Block Skip] button will be canceled. Unless the [Block Skip] button is displayed in blue, the block skip will not be executed.

Step 2 Select the block to be skipped.

On the “Block Skip setting dialog” screen, there is a check box in each block field.

1. Mark the check box of the block to be skipped, or select a block and press the [Check] button to

mark the check box of the selected block.

2. Press the [OK] button to exit the “Block Skip setting dialog” screen.

NOTE

When exiting the “Block Skip setting dialog” screen after setting the block skip, the [Block Skip] button will be displayed in blue on the “Setup” screen.

metadata.chapter: 3|Flow from machine Startup to End of Production
metadata.section: 1|Flowchart from machine Startup to End of Production

content:
Selecting blocks to be skipped

“Block Skip setting dialog” screen

The block data designated to be skipped can be checked on the [board] > [Mount] tab screen.

A message “Skip” will appear on each mounting point to be block-skipped and it is unable to edit

on this screen. However, the block number in the “Original Block No.” column which the mounting

point belongs to can be checked.

content:
1. Press the [START] button on the bottom side of the operation display.

2. (Only for the first time after setting block skip) The block skip confirmation message will appear.

Check the descriptions and press the [OK] button.

3. Press the [START] button once again to start up the automatic operation.

Block skip confirmation message

1 Specifications

YRM20/YRM20DL specifications

| Item | Specifications |
| --- | --- |
| Operating ambient temperature | 15 to 35°C |
| Operating ambient humidity | 20 to 80% (no condensation)  *Keep a humidity of approx. 40% or more as static electricity prevention  measures.  *When the ambient temperature rises more than the surface of the  machine, dew condensation might occur under the condition described  below. Note that dew condensation may cause the machine to break  down.  Condition of Dew Condensation:  Dew condensation might occur when the “Differences between  Ambient and Surface Temperatures of machine” reach the values or  more in the table below.  Differences between ambient and surface temperatures   Humidity  of machine  (%)  (Ambient Temperature > Surface Temperature)  80 3°C or more  70 6°C or more  60 8°C or more  50 10°C or more  40 14°C or more  30 18°C or more |
| Noise level | Under 78 dB |
| Power requirement (voltage and frequency) | 3-phase AC 200/208/220/240/380/400/416 V ±10%, 50/60 Hz |
| Power capacity | 2-beam / 1-beam | 2.5 kVA (Peak 5.4 kVA)*7 |
| Power capacity | 2-beam (YRM20DL)*11 | 3.1 kVA (Peak 7.1 kVA)*7 |
| Breaker rating | 30 A*8 |
| Maximum current | 55 A*9 |
| Average power  consumption | 2-beam | 2.2 kW |
| Average power  consumption | 2-beam (YRM20DL)*11 | 2.7 kW |
| Average power  consumption | 1-beam | 1.2 kW |
| Power cable (conductor cross-section area) | 6 mm2 or more |
| Overvoltage category*1 | Category III |
| Pollution degree*1 | Degree 2 |
| Supply air pressure*2 | 0.45 MPa or more |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 2-beam | RM · RM type | For YRM20, 60 L/min (average); 270 L/min (max.)*10 |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 2-beam | RM · RM type | For YRM20DL, 70 L/min (average); 250 L/min (max.)*10 |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 2-beam | HM · HM type | For YRM20, 260 L/min (average); 320 L/min (max.)*10 |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 2-beam | HM · HM type | For YRM20DL, 250 L/min (average); 310 L/min (max.)*10 |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 2-beam | FM · FM type | 160 L/min (average); 270 L/min (max.)*10 |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 2-beam | LM · LM type | 190 L/min (average); 290 L/min (max.)*10 |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 1-beam | RM type | 30 L/min (average); 260 L/min (max.)*10 |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 1-beam | HM type | 140 L/min (average); 260 L/min (max.)*10 |
| Air consumption  (ANR)*6 | 1-beam | FM type | 90 L/min (average); 260 L/min (max.)*10 |

| Item | Specifications |
| --- | --- |
| Altitude | 1,000 m or less above sea level |
| Board transport height*3 | 900 mm ±10 mm |
| Data | Number of mounting points*4 | 32,400 points |
| Data | Number of component types | 255 types per board |
| Data | Number of fiducial marks*5 | 128 sets per board |
| Data | Board data capacity per one machine | 500 MB |

*1: Complies with IEC60664-1.

*2: This value is different from the air pressure setting of the machine(0.40 MPa). Please supply clean and dry air treated     with an air dryer and air filter.

*3: Distance from the floor surface to the upper surface of conveyor belt.

*4: Decreases with the number of boards, blocks and fiducial marks.

*5: When using 2-points fiducial mode.

*6: Is a flow volume under condition of; Temperature: 20˚C, Relative humidity: 65%, Absolute pressure: 101.3 kPa (1.03       kgf/cm2 or 760 mmHg).

*7: When X and Y axes move at full speed.

*8: Includes the inrush current of the transformer.

*9: When 200 V power is supplied.

*10: If the machine is equipped with eATS30 (option), add the air consumption of 30 L/min for each.

If the machine is equipped with cATS10R (option), add the air consumption of 10 L/min for each.

If the machine is equipped with sATS30R (option), add the air consumption of 20 L/min for each.

If the machine is equipped with sATS30R (option), add the air consumption of 20 L/min for each.

If the machine is equipped with sATS30NSR (option), add the air consumption of 20 L/min for each.

If the machine is equipped with an ionizer (option), add the air consumption of 20 L/min per ionizer.

*11: “DL” indicates the Dual-lane type of the conveyor.

NOTE

See specification sheets for more detailed information not listed above.

2 User Support

Our service information can be obtained through the YAMAHA Surface Mounter Support & service website.

The following contents can be available for example.

| Item | Contents |
| --- | --- |
| Important notification | New/corrected service information |
| Manual download | Download the operation/maintenance manuals |
| Support items | Introduction of the list of maintenance tools, etc. |
| Training | Informations about periodical training schedule |
| Vision recognition | Recognition information of special parts such as coils |
| Troubleshooting | Supporting informations for trouble solutions |
| Circuit/air path diagram | Materials for investigation about the electrical troubles |
| Maintenance parts list | List of maintenance target parts |

NOTE

The user registration is necessary for using the YAMAHA Surface Mounter Support & service website.

The login ID and the first time password will be provided when completing your registration.

Contact your distributor for the detail on user registration.
